About Me

I'm a recent graduate of the Interactive Multimedia Design Degree at the University of Ulster, shortly returning to full time education to further my knowledge by studying a Masters Course in Multidisciplinary Design.

When I'm not studying, I can be quite often found tinkering, playing with, experimenting on and (occasionally) breaking code. I enjoy creating things and solving problems on the web.

Currently employed by Fresh Made Media, a fantastic web design studio based in Belfast. If you need any work done, I would highly recommend them (though I would as an employee, wouldn't I?).

About What I Do

As a web developer and designer I spend a lot of time looking at code. Fine tuning and tinkering with both how the site looks and how the site works. I do this to ensure that the sites I produce both look great and work great.

I dislike keeping my knowledge secret, making a point of trying to showcase as much of it as possible both on my journal and in my examples areas of my site. What use is knowledge, if you don't share it?

Personal Projects

Personal Projects are pieces of work I've engaged in for one of the best reasons known to man - because I can.

  • ReferenceIt - A webapp that makes referencing better for students
  • IMD Stats - A Tool for checking student statuses from IMD
